results.name: a(n) is the exponent of the eventual power of 2 reached when starting from n and using the map k -> k + k/p, where p can be any odd prime factor of k, for example, the largest.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: Totally additive sequence: a(2) = 1, a(p) = a(p+1) for odd primes p, a(m*n) = a(m)+a(n) for m, n > 1.
If A209229(n) == 1, a(n) = A007814(n), otherwise a(n) = a(n+A052126(n)), or equally, a(n) = a(n+(n/A078701(n))).
mathematica: Array[Log2@ NestWhile[# + #/FactorInteger[#][[-1, 1]] &, #, !IntegerQ@ Log2@ # &] &, 105] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 30 2020 *)
xref: Cf. also A064415 (analogous sequence when using the map k -> k - k/p).
